member.name: T:FHSDK.FH
member.summary: This is the main FeedHenry SDK class

member.summary: Get the current version of the FeedHenry .NET SDk

member.name: P:FHSDK.FH.TimeOut
member.summary: Get or Set the timeout value for all the requests. Default is 30 seconds.

member.name: M:FHSDK.FH.Init
member.summary: The actual implementation of initialising the FeedHenry SDK. It is called when the Init method of each platform's FHClient class called in. This way it will guarantee the platform's specific assembly will be loaded so that the ServiceFinder can find the correct implmenetation for some of the services. (The Adaptation approach used here works for wp and xamarain android without the FHClient reference. However, due to Xamarain IOS is using AOT compiler, we have to reference the FHClient class of the IOS SDK to make sure it will be loaded during compile.)
member.returns: If Init is success or not

member.name: M:FHSDK.FH.Act(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Invoke a cloud function which you have defined in cloud/main.js (the old way).
member.param: The name of the cloud function name
The parameters passed to the cloud function
member.returns: The response data returned by the cloud function
member.exception: It will be thrown if FH SDK is not ready.

member.name: M:FHSDK.FH.Auth(System.String)
member.summary: Call the FeedHenry Authentication API with the given policyId. This is normally used for OAuth type authentications. The user will be prompted for login details and the the login result will be returned.
member.param: The id of the new policy

member.name: M:FHSDK.FH.Auth(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Call the FeedHenry Authentication API with the given policyId, user name and password. This is normally used for LDAP and other basic authentication types.
member.param: The id of the auth policy

member.summary: If there is updates to the local data, should the sync loop be invoked immediately
member.value: true if auto sync local updates; otherwise, false.

member.summary: If a record is crashed during a sync loop, how many loops should it be waiting until try again

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncConfig.ResendCrashedUpdated
member.summary: If a record is crashed during a sync loop, should it be resent in the future
member.value: true if resend crashed updated; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncConfig.SyncActive
member.summary: Control if the sync should ba activated
member.value: true if sync active; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncConfig.SyncCloud
member.summary: Control if the sync client should be calling the FH MBAAS sync endpoint or the legacy (custom) sync endpoint
member.value: true if use custom sync; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:FHSDK.Sync.IFHSyncModel
member.summary: An instance to indicate that a data model can be used by the sync client. To allow the FHSyncClient to manage data syncing, the data models have to implement this interface.

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.IFHSyncModel.UID
member.summary: The unique universal id of the record. The implementation of the property should be public readable and writable, and non-serializable (e.g. use JsonIgnore attribute or NonSerializedAttribute). You should not set the value of the property in your code. The FHSyncClient will set the value for you.

member.name: T:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification
member.summary: The types of notifications that will be emitted by the sync client

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.ClientStorageFailed
member.summary: Failed to use the client storage

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.SyncStarted
member.summary: One sync loop has started

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.SyncCompleted
member.summary: One sync loop has completed successfully

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.OfflineUpdate
member.summary: The device is offline and the changes is only applied locally

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.CollisionDetected
member.summary: There is collision detected during the sync loop

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.RemoteUpdateApplied
member.summary: Local changes have been applied to remote server

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.RemoteUpdateFailed
member.summary: Local changes failed to apply to remote server

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.LocalUpdateApplied
member.summary: The changes have been applied to local dataset

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.DeltaReceived
member.summary: There are a batch of changes from remote server

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.RecordDeltaReceived
member.summary: There are updates for one record entry from remote server

member.name: F:FHSDK.Sync.SyncNotification.SyncFailed
member.summary: One sync loop finished with failure

member.name: T:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs
member.summary: The event arguments that will be sent to the sync event listeners

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs.DatasetId
member.summary: The id of the dataset

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs.Uid
member.summary: The unique universal id of the record

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs.Code
member.summary: Type fo the notification. See SyncNotification.

member.name: P:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs.Message
member.summary: An message associated with the event argument. Could be empty.

member.name: T:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient
member.summary: The client part of the FH Sync Framework. To use the sync framework, you just need to create a data model that implements the IFHSyncModel interface, and let the sync client manage that data model for you. The sync framework will manage the data model for offline use and sync with the cloud when possible. If a data model is managed by the sync framework, you should only use the sync framework for any CRUD operations for that model.

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.ClientStorageFailed
member.summary: Notify client storage failed event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.SyncStarted
member.summary: Notify sync loop started event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.SyncCompleted
member.summary: Notify sync loop complete event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.OfflineUpdate
member.summary: Notify offline update event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.CollisionDetected
member.summary: Notify collision detected event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.RemoteUpdateFailed
member.summary: Notify remote update failed event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.LocalUpdateApplied
member.summary: Notify local update applied event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.RemoteUpdateApplied
member.summary: Notify remote update applied event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.DeltaReceived
member.summary: Notify delta received event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.RecordDeltaReceived
member.summary: Notify record delta received event

member.name: E:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.SyncFailed
member.summary: Notify sync loop failed event

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.OnSyncNotification(FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncNotificationEventArgs)
member.summary: Send the event notification

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.GetInstance
member.summary: Get the singleton instance of the FHSyncClient

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Initialise(FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncConfig)
member.summary: Set the global FHSyncConfig for all the datasets. This will be used for all the dataset if no instance of FHSyncConfig is provided when managing a sync data model.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Manage``1(System.String,FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncConfig,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Manage the specified sync data model that implements the IFHSyncModel.
member.param: Dataset identifier. The datasetId needs to be unique for your app and will be used to name the database collection in the cloud.
Sync config. If this is null, the global syncConfig will be used.
A query parameter that will be passed to the cloud when initialise the dataset.
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.List``1(System.String)
member.summary: List the data records for the specified datasetId.
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Read``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Read the data records with the specified datasetId and uid.
member.param: The unique id of the data model
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Create``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Create a new data record with the specified datasetId and an instance of the model. The new data record will be synced to the cloud automatically.
member.param: An instance of the data model T.
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Update``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Update the data record with the specified datasetId and model. The changes of the data record will be synced to the cloud automatically. In case of collision, the collision will be recorded and the local change will be reverted to match the cloud entry.
member.param: An instance of the data model T.
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Delete``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Delete the data record with the specified datasetId and model. The deletion will be applied to local data immediately and sync with cloud when possible. In case of collision, the collision will be recorded and the local change will be reverted to match the cloud entry.
member.param: The uid of the record to delete
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Stop``1(System.String)
member.summary: Stop syncing the specified dataset with the cloud. All the changes will be saved locally only.
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.Start``1(System.String)
member.summary: Start syncing the specified dataset with the cloud if possible
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.ForceSync``1(System.String)
member.summary: Invoke a sync loop almost immediately. It will guarantee a sync loop will run in the next 500 milliseconds (even the data model has set to stop sync - but not if StopAll is called.).
member.typeparam: It should be a type that implements IFHSyncModel.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.StopAll
member.summary: Stop syncing all local data models.

member.name: M:FHSDK.Sync.FHSyncClient.StartAll
member.summary: Start syncing all local data models.
